TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IProcessingInstruction implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Org.W3c.Dom.INode, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: The ProcessingInstruction interface represents a "processing instruction", used in XML as a way to keep processor-specific information in the text of the document.

remarks.para: The ProcessingInstruction interface represents a "processing instruction", used in XML as a way to keep processor-specific information in the text of the document.

No lexical check is done on the content of a processing instruction and it is therefore possible to have the character sequence "?>" in the content, which is illegal a processing instruction per section 2.6 of []. The presence of this character sequence must generate a fatal error during serialization.

Docs.summary: The content of this processing instruction.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
The content of this processing instruction. This is from the first non white space character after the target to the character immediately preceding the ?>.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
The content of this processing instruction. This is from the first non white space character after the target to the character immediately preceding the ?>.

Docs.summary: The target of this processing instruction.

remarks.para: The target of this processing instruction. XML defines this as being the first token following the markup that begins the processing instruction.
